page.title: 16 FABER SCHOOL
page.content: Faber School,Cotton,designed by Pugin, was built in 1847.Rev.Fr.Faber,who was working in the parish,wrote many hymns including "Faith of Our Fathers" and "Flowers for the Altar",which was for the children in school.When the College took over their present buildings they used the school for a while,then it was used as a house.Meanwhile there was a school in Golden Hill Farm where one of the children was killed in a fire.This was Charlette Bamford,a relative of a current pupil.The school reopened in 1897 and pupils,who started at 4+,left at 14+.Both Nuns,who lived next door to the school,and lay teachers,have taught here but now there are 2 staff, Mr.Jupp,the head teacher,and Mrs.Brown, a former pupil,helped by Mrs.Moss and Mrs.Powell.Pupils go on to Painsley, Cheadle High or the College,having been taught the usual range of subjects.
